abstract: Steven P. Jobs told Apple employees that he will take a medical leave of absence until the end of June, in part because his health issues are “more complex” than he thought.
snippet: Steven P. Jobs told Apple employees that he will take a medical leave of absence until the end of June, in part because his health issues are “more complex” than he thought.
lead_paragraph: Steven P. Jobs, Apple’s co-founder and chief executive, told the company’s employees in a letter on Wednesday that he would take a leave of absence through June in order to focus on his health. Mr. Jobs said last week that he was being treated for a hormone problem. Here is the text of his letter as released by Apple.

headline.main: Text of Steve Jobs’s Letter to Apple Employees

abstract: Saying his health issues were “more complex” than he originally thought, Steven P. Jobs is taking a leave until the end of June.
snippet: Saying his health issues were “more complex” than he originally thought, Steven P. Jobs is taking a leave until the end of June.
lead_paragraph: Casting a pall over one of the world’s most closely watched companies, Steven P. Jobs, chief executive of Apple, said on Wednesday that he was taking a leave of absence because of health concerns.

headline.main: Apple’s Chief Takes a Medical Leave

abstract: Fusion Electronics has created an AM-FM car stereo, the CA-IP500, that also is an internal dock for your iPod.
snippet: Fusion Electronics has created an AM-FM car stereo, the CA-IP500, that also is an internal dock for your iPod.
lead_paragraph: Pre-iPod, drivers who wanted to listen to music had little alternative to turning on their radio or manually inserting compact discs (or cassette tapes) into a player. After Apple’s music player arrived, drivers who wanted to ditch those options for the iPod largely had to be content with an external iPod setup, complete with cords, brackets and other unwieldy arrangements.

headline.main: Forget the Cigarette Lighter Adapter. Now You Can Dock Your iPod in the Car Radio.
headline.print_headline: Forget the Cigarette Lighter Adapter. Now You Can Dock Your iPod in the Car Radio.
